memberdef.type: detail::convert_base_types_t< T, typename T_Sbx::T_ShortType, typename T_Sbx::T_IntType, typename T_Sbx::T_LongType, typename T_Sbx::T_LongLongType, typename T_Sbx::T_PointerType >
memberdef.definition: using rlbox::rlbox_sandbox< T_Sbx >::convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_nonclass_t = detail::convert_base_types_t<T, typename T_Sbx::T_ShortType, typename T_Sbx::T_IntType, typename T_Sbx::T_LongType, typename T_Sbx::T_LongLongType, typename T_Sbx::T_PointerType>
memberdef.name: convert_to_sandbox_equivalent_nonclass_t

briefdescription.para: Unused member that allows the calling code to save data in a "per-sandbox" storage. This can be useful to save context which is used in callbacks.
Unregister a callback function and disallow the sandbox from calling this function henceforth.

parameterdescription.para: Arguments passed to the underlying sandbox implementation. For the null sandbox, no arguments are necessary.

briefdescription.para: Destroy sandbox and reclaim any memory.
Allocate a new pointer that is accessible to both the application and sandbox. The pointer is allocated in sandbox memory.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the pointer you want to create. If T=int, this would return a pointer to an int.

simplesect.para: tainted<T*, T_Sbx> Tainted pointer accessible to the application and sandbox.

briefdescription.para: Allocate an array that is accessible to both the application and sandbox. The pointer is allocated in sandbox memory.

parameterdescription.para: The type of the array elements you want to create. If T=int, this would return a pointer to an array of ints.
The number of array elements to allocate.

simplesect.para: tainted<T*, T_Sbx> Tainted pointer accessible to the application and sandbox.

briefdescription.para: Free the memory referenced by the tainted pointer.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to sandbox memory to free.

briefdescription.para: Free the memory referenced by a tainted_volatile pointer ref.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer reference to sandbox memory to free.

briefdescription.para: Free the memory referenced by a tainted_opaque pointer.

parameterdescription.para: Opaque pointer to sandbox memory to free.

briefdescription.para: Check if the pointer points to this sandbox's memory. For the null-sandbox, this always returns true.
Check if the pointer points to application memory. For the null-sandbox, this always returns true.
For internal use only. Grant access of the passed in buffer in to the sandbox instance. Called by internal APIs only if the underlying sandbox supports can_grant_deny_access by including the line.

memberdef.argsstring: (tainted< T *, T_Sbx > src, size_t num, bool &success)
memberdef.name: INTERNAL_deny_access

briefdescription.para: For internal use only. Grant access of the passed in buffer in to the sandbox instance. Called by internal APIs only if the underlying sandbox supports can_grant_deny_access by including the line.
Expose a callback function to the sandboxed code.

parameterdescription.para: Return type of callback. Must be tainted or void.
Types of remaining callback arguments. Must be tainted.

simplesect.para: Wrapped callback function pointer that can be passed to the sandbox.

briefdescription.para: Create a "fake" pointer referring to a location in the application memory.

simplesect.para: The app_pointer object that refers to this location.

briefdescription.para: The mirror of get_app_pointer. Take a tainted pointer which is actually an app_pointer, and get the application location being pointed to.

parameterdescription.para: The tainted pointer that is actually an app_pointer

simplesect.para: The original location being referred to by the app_ptr

briefdescription.para: Check if two pointers are in the same sandbox. For the null-sandbox, this always returns true.

parameterdescription.para: Type of sandbox. For the null sandbox this is rlbox_noop_sandbox
